gti_step_past_bp_events.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00011 #ifndef GTI_STEP_PAST_BP_EVENTS_H
00012 #define GTI_STEP_PAST_BP_EVENTS_H
00013 
00014 // This is an interface that a GTI driver can use to notify other components in
00015 // the system that it's about to step past a breakpoint prior to a run.  
00016 // Clients can listen to this event and respond to it if needed.  For instance, 
00017 // such a step will generate a halt which could have implications on other 
00018 // cores in the system if cross triggering of some form is enabled.  Clients 
00019 // that setup cross triggering can use this event to temporarily disable cross
00020 // triggering.
00021 
00022 typedef const char* ( *StepPastBpEventFn )( void* pContext );
00023 
00024 typedef struct StepPastBpEvents_
00025 {
00026         // Called to notify clients before the target is stepped past a breakpoint.
00027         //
00028         // If a non-null, non-empty error is returned, the caller should not 
00029         // attempt to step past the breakpoint and should abort with the error 
00030         // indicated.  FinishedSteppingPast does not need to be calledin that case.
00031         
00032         StepPastBpEventFn aboutToStepPast;
00033         
00034         // Called to notify clients after the target has been stepped past the 
00035         // breakpoint and is halted.
00036         // 
00037         // If a non-null, non-empty error is returned, the caller abort with the 
00038         // error indicated.
00039         
00040         StepPastBpEventFn finishedSteppingPast;
00041         
00042         // Client context to be  passed to both event functions.
00043         
00044         void* pContext;
00045 } StepPastBpEvents;
00046 
00047 #endif // GTI_STEP_PAST_BP_EVENTS_H
